greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: One half of the fundamental positive solution y = y1(n) of the first class of the Pell equation x^2 - 2*y^2 = A007519(n), n >= 1 (primes congruent to 1 mod 8).
comment: For the corresponding term x1(n) see A254760(n).
See A254760 also for the Nagell reference.
The least positive y solutions (that is the ones of the first class) for the primes +1 and -1 (mod 8) together (including in the first class also prime 2) are given in A002335.
formula: A254760(n)^2 - 2*(2*a(n))^2 = A007519(n) gives the smallest positive (proper) solution of this (generalized) Pell equation.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 12 2015
